timeline.message:
Make the current loadbalancer into 'legacy'.
Add a new 'adaptive' loadbalancer that uses select-best-of-2-random-picks.
Add test and fix loadbalancer selection.
Control docproc loadbalancer type with feature flag.

timeline.bodyText: Do we need any special handling of candidateA == candidateB?
timeline.author: vekterli

replies.bodyText: You tell me, will it have any statistical impact, or will it just drown in randomness.
replies.author: baldersheim

replies.bodyText: Probably the latter, although I'm not smart enough to crunch the numbers on it 🙂 Easiest would be to measure it in practice in the unit test over a set of runs. If there is a measurable better distribution if the two candidates are forced to be unequal, it would make sense to include it.
replies.author: vekterli

replies.bodyText: After a reading a bit on the algorithm I concluded that it would indeed be better to ensure 2 distinct candidates. The reason is that when same candidate is selected fro both A and B it is in-fact a degradation into pure random. Looking at the numbers made it a simple choice.
replies.author: baldersheim

timeline.bodyText: Since this is based on randomness, should we have a separate constructor overload for AdaptiveLoadBalancer taking in Random instance explicitly? This would allow us to use a deterministic seed for unit tests.
timeline.author: vekterli

replies.bodyText: Fixed, I also changed the test to use equals as the results are repeatable.

timeline.message:
Follow up after PR comments.
- Make system test deterministic.
- Add @Override and be consistent on white space.
Ensure we can not pick the same candidate twice. This make it react a lot faster especially with few nodes.
